channel.itunes:author: PodcastOne / Carolla Digital
channel.title: Adam Carolla Show
channel.description:
Welcome to the Adam Carolla Show! The new home for the rantings and ravings of Adam CarollThe Adam Carolla Show is the #1 Daily Downloaded Podcast in the World. GET IT ON as Adam shares his thoughts on current events, relationships, airport security, specialty pizzas, politics, and anything else he can complain about. Five days a week and completely uncensored, Adam welcomes a wide range of guests to join him in studio for in depth interviews and a front row seat to his unparalleled ranting. Let's not forget Bryan Bishop (Bald Bryan) on sound effects.
Check it out as Adam hangs out with some of his pals like: Larry Miller, David Allen Grier, Dr. Drew Pinksy, Dana Gould, Doug Benson, and many, many more.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to the Adam Carolla Show! The new home for the rantings and ravings of Adam CarollThe Adam Carolla Show is the #1 Daily Downloaded Podcast in the World. GET IT ON as Adam shares his thoughts on current events, relationships,...
channel.itunes:summary:
Welcome to the Adam Carolla Show! The new home for the rantings and ravings of Adam CarollThe Adam Carolla Show is the #1 Daily Downloaded Podcast in the World. GET IT ON as Adam shares his thoughts on current events, relationships, airport security, specialty pizzas, politics, and anything else he can complain about. Five days a week and completely uncensored, Adam welcomes a wide range of guests to join him in studio for in depth interviews and a front row seat to his unparalleled ranting. Let's not forget Bryan Bishop (Bald Bryan) on sound effects.
Check it out as Adam hangs out with some of his pals like: Larry Miller, David Allen Grier, Dr. Drew Pinksy, Dana Gould, Doug Benson, and many, many more.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Anatomy Awards with Mr. Skin + David Wain’s A Futile and Stupid Gesture
item.description: Mr. Skin calls in to chat with Adam about this year’s Anatomy Awards. Later, David Wain talks about directing ‘A Futile and Stupid Gesture’, and comments on news stories about 4G internet on the moon, and a new line of scotch for women.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): David Arquette and Matthew Cooke + Oscar Odds with RJ Bell
item.description: David Arquette and Matthew Cooke talk to Adam about why we need to stop looking at prison as the answer to all our problems, and why we should end the war on drugs. Plus, RJ Bell calls in to review odds on this year’s Academy Awards.
item.content:encoded: David Arquette and Matthew Cooke talk to Adam about why we need to stop looking at prison as the answer to all our problems, and why we should end the war on drugs. Plus, RJ Bell calls in to review odds on this year’s Academy Awards.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Ian Bagg + The Language of Losers
item.description: Ian Bagg returns for a podcast about the etiquette of entering someone’s home, cops who write jaywalking tickets, and the language of losers. The guys also comment on statistics about pet custody after divorce, and The Weinstein Company filing for bankruptcy.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Jim Florentine + Los Angeles Dumps
item.description: Jim Florentine chats with Adam about their Crank Yankers days, his new book, and musicians who perform out of their mind on drugs. The guys also discuss an adult toy that orders pizza for you, Quincy Jones’ apology tour, and how to improve your online dating profile.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Rob Schneider’s History Lesson + Huell’s Jewels with Dana Gould
item.description: Rob Schneider returns with another fascinating history lesson, and chats about horse fighting, the second amendment, and ‘fairness’. Plus, Dana Gould is back for a hilarious round of Huell’s Jewels.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Heather Graham and Chris D’Elia + Black Panther Baldywood
item.description: Heather Graham joins the podcast to discuss her directorial debut, ‘Half Magic’. Plus, Chris D’Elia returns for a hilarious round of WWJCVDD, and Bald Bryan reviews ‘Black Panther’ for this week’s Baldywood.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Dr. Drew, Winter Ozlympics with Jeff Cesario and Chasing Coral with Jeff Orlowski
item.description: Dr. Drew comments on a fart fight on a plane. Plus, documentarian Jeff Orlowski talks about his latest film, ‘Chasing Coral’, and everyone plays a new game called ‘Winter Ozlympics’.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Mark Geragos + Phone Calls
item.description: Mark Geragos drops in to comment on a strange case involving graffiti artists. The guys also take calls, and Adam goes on an epic rant about people who don’t use their turn indicators.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Dennis Prager + Pete Holmes
item.description: Dennis Prager returns for a conversation about common sense, and how to deter school shootings. Later, Pete Holmes is in studio to chat about HBO’s Crashing, pursuing your dreams, and another public pooper apprehended.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Joel McHale + Made Up Movie
item.description: Joel McHale returns to discuss his new Netflix show, what it was like playing Chevy Chase, and the time Adam couldn’t get past security to get on The Soup. Plus, everyone takes calls for a round of Made Up Movie.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Drumming Legend Kenny Aronoff + Valentine’s Day Rotten Tomatoes Game
item.description: Kenny Aronoff chats about his legendary drumming career, and shares stories about onstage fights, his process in studio, and the perils of plagiarism. Plus, Ronnie from Corona calls in to ask Gina to be his Valentine, and the guys play a Valentine’s Day themed round of the Rotten Tomatoes Game.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Matt Lewis on the Identity Crisis of the GOP + Health Tips with Vinnie Tortorich

item.title: ACS (Part 1): Mr. Carolla Goes To Washington + US Olympic Gold and Baldywood Review of ‘A Futile and Stupid Gesture’
item.description: Adam talks about his stay at the infamous Watergate Hotel, his visit to NASA, and satisfying performance at the Kennedy Center. Plus, Bald Bryan reviews ‘A Futile and Stupid Gesture’ for today’s Baldywood.

item.title: ACS (Part 1): The Sklar Brothers + Jeff Cesario
item.description: The Sklar Brothers return to discuss their new documentary, ‘Poop Talk’, and play a round of ‘Hobo Power’. Plus, Jeff Cesario talks to Adam about the difficulty of good character work, and being interviewed by people who are unprepared.
